chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine L. Santiago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Carrying License. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: ** Amended 4/15/16 to include attorney fees paid to Edmund Jelinski in the amount of $322.00. **

A.D.A. James Fassbender appeared for the state.
Atty. Edmund Jelinski appeared on behalf of the defendant, who was not present.
Per Atty. Jelinski, defendant has reinstated her operating privileges.
The state moves to amend Count 1 to a county ordinance violation for failure to carry license on person.
Atty. Jelinski enters a plea of no contest on behalf of his client to amended Count 1. Plea accepted by the Court and a fine of $50.00 plus costs is ordered, due in 60 days.
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
